intro: Saussurea balangshanensis, commonly known as the Balangshan saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and numerous yellowish to brownish composite flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Saussurea balangshanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
